diagnoses.name: Hypersensitivity Disorders
diagnoses.description: Conditions such as allergies or certain types of asthma that may link interstitial cystitis, anxiety, basophilia, wheezing, and elevated immunoglobulins.

diagnoses.name: Asthma
diagnoses.description: A respiratory condition marked by spasms in the bronchi of the lungs, causing difficulty in breathing. It can be associated with allergens or stress, linking it to wheezing, anxiety, and indirectly to basophilia through allergic pathways.

diagnoses.name: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE)
diagnoses.description: An autoimmune disease that can affect multiple systems including the urinary tract and immune system, leading to a variety of symptoms including those listed. Elevated immunoglobulin levels can be a response to chronic inflammation.

diagnoses.name: Chronic Urticaria
diagnoses.description: Also known as hives, it can be linked to allergies and autoimmunity, presenting with symptoms such as anxiety due to the chronic discomfort and stress, and increased immunoglobulins due to the allergic response.

diagnoses.name: Churg-Strauss Syndrome
diagnoses.description: A disorder marked by blood vessel inflammation which can affect various organs, including the lungs and the urinary system, potentially leading to symptoms such as wheezing and basophilia.

diagnoses.name: Interstitial Lung Disease
diagnoses.description: Involves a group of disorders that cause progressive scarring of lung tissue, potentially leading to wheezing. It may sometimes be associated with systemic diseases that can also cause increased immunoglobulins.

diagnoses.name: Hypereosinophilic Syndrome
diagnoses.description: A condition characterized by high eosinophil counts which can cause damage to multiple organs, including the lungs and possibly affecting the urinary tract, thus may be considered with wheezing and increased immunoglobulins.

diagnoses.name: Chronic Sinusitis
diagnoses.description: Inflammation of the sinuses that can lead to persistent wheezing, increased immunoglobulin levels as part of an immune response, and can be stressful enough to induce or worsen anxiety.

diagnoses.name: Mast Cell Activation Syndrome (MCAS)
diagnoses.description: A condition where mast cells release too much of their content into the bloodstream, potentially leading to a wide range of symptoms including interstitial cystitis, anxiety, and wheezing.

diagnoses.name: Common Variable Immune Deficiency (CVID)
diagnoses.description: An immune system disorder that is characterized by low levels of several immune proteins and increased risk of infections, but paradoxically can present with symptoms of increased immunoglobulins in some aspects.

diagnoses: Blepharospasm (as part of Benign Essential Blepharospasm)
Psoriasis with skin and nail involvement

diagnoses.reasoning: Cushing's syndrome can manifest with depression, striae due to skin thinning, hypoglycemia due to insulin resistance, and could indirectly affect systemic conditions contributing to issues like vaginitis. Hearing loss is not a typical feature but can be associated due to the overall health impact.

PCOS can lead to depression due to hormonal imbalances, striae from rapid weight changes, and hypoglycemia related to insulin resistance. Vaginitis can occur due to hormonal imbalances. Hearing loss is less directly associated but could be considered in broader symptom assessments.

Addison's disease involves adrenal insufficiency which can cause depression, hypoglycemia due to cortisol's role in glucose metabolism, and skin changes that might include striae. Vaginitis might occur due to general health deterioration. Hearing loss is not directly associated.

Diabetes can lead to depression due to the psychological impact of chronic illness, hypoglycemia as a result of insulin treatment mishaps, and vaginitis due to glucose in the urine promoting yeast growth. Striae can occur with weight gain. Hearing loss has been associated with diabetes.

Hypothyroidism can present with depression due to hormonal imbalances, and while hypoglycemia is less common, it can occur. Striae are not a classic symptom but could appear due to weight changes. Vaginitis and hearing loss can also be manifestations but are not the primary symptoms.

Chronic liver disease may present with depression, hypoglycemia due to impaired glucose storage, and striae due to hormonal imbalances affecting the skin. Vaginitis could occur due to overall health impairment. Hearing loss is less directly associated.

SLE can cause depression and affect multiple organs, leading to skin manifestations like striae, hypoglycemia due to adrenal involvement, and vaginitis as a manifestation of overall inflammation. Hearing loss could occur due to lupus affecting the nerves.

This condition can lead to hypoglycemia, depression due to hormonal imbalance, and possibly striae from hormone effect on the skin. Vaginitis could be seen due to the hormonal disruptions. Hearing loss is not directly associated.

HIV/AIDS can present with depression due to the psychological impact, striae from medication or nutritional conditions, hypoglycemia due to infection or treatment, and vaginitis due to immunosuppression. Hearing loss could theoretically be associated with certain opportunistic infections or neurologic involvement.

In cases where a primary psychiatric disorder influences the perception or reporting of physical symptoms, depression could be the underlying cause, with striae, hypoglycemia, vaginitis, and hearing loss representing somatized concerns rather than direct physiological issues.

diagnoses.name: Takotsubo cardiomyopathy
diagnoses.description: Also known as stress-induced cardiomyopathy, this condition often presents similarly to a heart attack but involves temporary weakening of the myocardium due to emotional or physical stress.

diagnoses.name: Anxiety disorders
diagnoses.description: Includes a range of conditions such as generalized anxiety disorder (GAD), panic disorder, and phobias, often presenting with excessive nervousness, fear, apprehension, and worry.

diagnoses.name: Dermatologic conditions
diagnoses.description: Conditions affecting the skin, such as human papillomavirus (HPV) infections, which can lead to the development of warts.

diagnoses.name: Oral health conditions
diagnoses.description: Various diseases affecting the oral cavity and dentition, including dental caries, gingivitis, periodontitis, and tooth abscesses that can cause oral pain.

diagnoses.name: Presyncope
diagnoses.description: A state of lightheadedness, muscular weakness, and feeling faint without losing consciousness, often caused by low blood pressure or sudden changes in body position.

diagnoses.name: Cardiovascular disorders
diagnoses.description: This encompasses a broad range of conditions affecting the heart and blood vessels, which could potentially underlie presyncope and takotsubo cardiomyopathy.

diagnoses.name: Psychological stress
diagnoses.description: A feeling of strain and pressure which might not only lead to anxiety but also trigger events leading to conditions like takotsubo cardiomyopathy.

diagnoses.name: Viral infections
diagnoses.description: Certain viral infections can be responsible for the appearance of warts (due to HPV) and also affect overall health causing symptoms such as anxiety or stress.

diagnoses.name: Oral mucosal conditions
diagnoses.description: Infections, irritations, and other conditions affecting the mucosal surfaces inside the mouth, potentially causing oral pain.

diagnoses.name: Somatoform disorders
diagnoses.description: A group of psychiatric disorders where patients experience physical symptoms that are inconsistent with or cannot fully be explained by any underlying general medical or neurologic condition, which might correlate with symptoms like presyncope and anxiety.

diagnoses: Dehydration (due to vomiting leading to hypotension)
Common cold (viral upper respiratory tract infection)

diagnoses.name: Migraine
diagnoses.description: A neurological condition that can cause multiple symptoms. It's frequently characterized by intense, debilitating headaches. Symptoms may include nausea, vomiting, difficulty speaking, numbness or tingling, and sensitivity to light and sound.

diagnoses.name: Meningitis
diagnoses.description: An inflammation of the fluid and membranes surrounding your brain and spinal cord. Symptoms can include headache, fever, neck stiffness, vomiting, photophobia, and altered consciousness.

diagnoses.name: Multiple Sclerosis
diagnoses.description: A disease in which the immune system eats away at the protective covering of nerves. Symptoms include numbness or weakness in one or more limbs, partial or complete loss of vision, prolonged double vision, and tingling or pain in parts of your body.

diagnoses.name: Brain Abscess
diagnoses.description: An abscess is a collection of pus that has built up within the tissue of the body. A brain abscess is a rare but serious condition where a collection of pus develops in the brain. Symptoms might include headache, fever, vomiting, changes in vision, confusion, and problems with coordination.

diagnoses.name: Vestibular Schwannoma (Acoustic Neuroma)
diagnoses.description: A benign tumor on the main nerve leading from the inner ear to the brain. Symptoms can include hearing loss on one side, ringing in the ears, dizziness, balance problems, and facial numbness.

diagnoses.name: Lyme Disease
diagnoses.description: An infectious disease caused by the Borrelia bacterium which is spread by ticks. Symptoms can include fever, headache, fatigue, and a characteristic skin rash called erythema migrans. If left untreated, infection can spread to joints, the heart, and the nervous system.

diagnoses.name: Guillain-Barre Syndrome
diagnoses.description: A rare disorder in which your body's immune system attacks your nerves. Weakness and tingling in your extremities are usually the first symptoms. These sensations can quickly spread, eventually paralyzing your whole body.

diagnoses.name: Subarachnoid Hemorrhage
diagnoses.description: An emergency condition where bleeding occurs between the brain and the tissues that cover it. Symptoms include a sudden, severe headache, vomiting, decrease in consciousness, and photophobia.

diagnoses.name: Cryptococcal Meningitis
diagnoses.description: A serious fungal infection of the meninges that can occur in individuals with a weak immune system. Symptoms may include fever, headache, stiff neck, nausea, vomiting, photophobia, and altered mental status.

diagnoses.name: Intracranial Hemorrhage
diagnoses.description: Occurs when blood suddenly bursts into brain tissue, causing damage to the brain. Symptoms can include a sudden headache, vomiting, a decreased level of consciousness, numbness or paralysis, especially on one side of the body, and difficulty speaking or understanding speech.

diagnoses: Rheumatoid Arthritis with Associated Felty's Syndrome
Rheumatoid Arthritis (with secondary anemia, thrombocytopenia, and neurological manifestations)
Viral infections (e.g., Parvovirus B19, Epstein-Barr virus)
Schizophrenia (for psychosis if not due to a physical health issue)
Hepatitis B or C with Cryoglobulinemia
